greeting: Greetings from The On-Line Encyclopedia of Integer Sequences! http://oeis.org/

results.name: Triangle read by rows: T(n,k) is the number of permutations of {1,2,...,n} having k adjacent pairs of the form (even,even) (0<=k<=floor(n/2)-1).
comment: Sum of entries in row n = n! = A000142(n).
maple: T:=proc(n,k) if `mod`(n, 2) = 0 then factorial((1/2)*n)^2*binomial((1/2)*n-1, k)*binomial((1/2)*n+1, k+1) else factorial((1/2)*n-1/2)*factorial((1/2)*n+1/2)*binomial((1/2)*n-3/2, k)*binomial((1/2)* n+3/2, k+2) end if end proc: 1; 1; for n from 2 to 12 do seq(T(n, k), k = 0 .. floor((1/2)*n)-1) end do; # yields sequence in triangular form
results.author: _Emeric Deutsch_, Nov 30 2008
